description: Construction of a three storey detached dwellinghouse (1x3 bedrooms) inclusive of basement with associated bike store, bin storage,  amenity space and landscape (following demolition of existing dwellinghouse)
decision_conditions: 1. The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

2. The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with submitted drawings / documentation, specifically being Existing Location & Block Site Plan, Drawing Number 6ANG-100-P1-100, Revision A, dated 18/08/2016; Existing Plans & Elevations, Drawing Number 6ANG-100-P1-101, Revision A, dated 18/08/2016; Proposed Location Plan & Block Site Plan, Drawing Number 6ANG-200-P1-100, dated 18/08/2016; Proposed Floor Plans, Drawing Number 6ANG-200-P1-101, Revision C, dated 18/08/2016; Proposed Elevations & Sections, Drawing Number 6ANG-200-P1-102, Revision C, dated 18/08/2016; Proposed Site Set-Up Tree Protection, Drawing Number 6ANG-200-P1-001, dated 18/08/2016; Arboricultural Impact Assessment Report, Reference Number INK/6ANGN/AIA/01, dated 29/09/2016; Ink Bespoke Design and Access Statement.
REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

3. Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces as shown on the approved plans of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies Ealing Local Variation to London Plan Policy 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 (h) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy (2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (Consolidated 2015).

4. Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D, E and F of Part 1 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification, no extension, enlargement or other alteration of the dwellinghouse other than that expressly authorized by this permission shall be carried out without planning permission first obtained from the local planning authority.

REASON: The local planning authority considers that further development could cause detriment to the amenities of the occupiers of nearby properties or to the character of the area and for this reason would wish to control any future development to comply with

section 7 pf the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policy 1.1 (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (Consolidated 2015).

5. Building envelope insulation for the approved residential building, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the local planning authority:
o	Bedrooms (23:00-0700 hrs) 30 dB LAeq, and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
o	Living rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 35dB LAeq.
o	Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first use and / or first occupation of the units and maintained thereafter.

REASON: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 7.15 of the London Plan (Consolidated 2015); Policy 1.1(j) of Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration.

6. Cycle storage with minimum dimensions of 1.2m x 2m, for a minimum of two (2) bicycles shall be provided onsite in accordance with the approved Bl Proposed Floor Plans, Drawing Number 6ANG-200-P1-101, Revision C, dated 18/08/2016 and all adopted standards prior to occupation of the building and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.

REASON: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists and refuse, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Core Strategy and policy 5.16, 6.9 and 7.5 of the London Plan (Consolidated 2015).

7. Prior to the development hereby permitted being first occupied, all windows at first and second floor level of the east (rear) facing elevation, and first floor level of the west (front) facing elevation shall be glazed with obscured glass, and this glazing shall be maintained for the life of the development.

REASON: To safeguard the amenities and privacy of the occupiers of adjoining properties, in accordance with section 7 pf the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policy 1.1 (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2015.

8. A detailed construction method statement (including the excavation and the construction of the basement) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced. The statement shall include details of phasing and programming, removal of earth from site; construction methods; site management and access; vehicle and machinery specifications and numbers/frequency of vehicles/deliveries, construction worker parking, anticipated number, delivery times, dust suppression measures, site security, vehicle manoeuvring and turning, locations for the storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors offices, procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents, measures to ensure the construction process does not effect of neighbouring highways, details of wheel water spraying facilities and noise/vibration mitigation measures. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved method statement.

REASON: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with 1.1 (e) (j) 1.2 (f), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 6.3, 6.13,  7.14 and 7.15  of the London Plan Consolidated (2015), the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise

9. The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage, in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards, has been provided in the curtilage of the proposed building as indicated on the approved plans and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

REASON: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Adopted Ealing Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policies 7.4, and 7.6 of the London Plan (Consolidated 2015).

10. Existing trees adjacent/close to the boundaries of the site shall not be lopped, felled or otherwise affected. Protection of the trees, hedgerows and groups of mature shrubs off site that are adjacent/close to it shall be fully implemented and maintained fully intact and (in the case of the fencing) at all times, until the completion of all building operations on the site.

REASON:  In order to safeguard trees and other vegetation considered to be worthy of retention in the interests of the visual amenity of the area as a whole, in pursuance to the objectives of section 11 and 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies7.4, 7.8 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2015,  policies 1.1 (e) (g), 1.2(f), of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines' and British Standard 5837:2012 'Trees In Relation To Construction Recommendations'.
